attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.description: Internal audit conducted stock take on 24th January 2025 and found that most of the stock items had a minimal variations except bread stock which had a variations of 98 loaves.
attributes.recommendation: Branch manager to tighten bread  stock controls to mitigate the risk.
attributes.effect: Negative variation on bread stock resulted to loss of revenue Ksh. 5,194.00

value: Internal audit conducted a physical stocks count in the branch, the objective was to establish if the physical stocks was matching with the book stocks.

attributes.title: Crates Stock Take
attributes.description:
Internal audit counted crates in the branch and added route crates balance and loading. 

The branch should  have 3803 crates, the total crate which were counted and verified was 3,316 crates. 487 crates could be counted.
attributes.recommendation:
• The crates which could not be counted should be recovered.
  • The branch needs to tighten crates control to mitigate the loss of the company Assets
  • Branch to introduce controls to track crates taken for cleaning to Eldoret branch. This will help to control the crates movement.

value: To ensure that the  physical crates were matching with the book balance.

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description: Bread produced in the branch were randomly selected and weighed to establish if bread sent to market are of the minimum weight. Underweight were noted as illustrated below:-
attributes.recommendation: Branch need to tighten controls for bread weight from dividing table to packing area. The branch should enforce FIFO method in slicing to reduce overcooling.
attributes.effect: Underweight bread if caught by weight and measures official could lead to heavy penalties and also can cause reputational risk.

value: we will closely monitor underweight by enhancing bread weight controls.

Underweights were caused by overcooling and prolonged baking time resulting to high moisture loss. The branch manager should ensure that slicers are not skipping bread and production process are followed to the latter.

attributes.title: Production Damages
attributes.description:
Analysis of the production damages was done to determine if the damages were within the set standard of 0.2%  of the total production. The audit period was from 1st to 23rd January, 2025. 

It was found that production damages were averaging 0.23% this excluded oven damages of 693 loaves. The table below illustrates the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should produced good products to reduce the loss and maintain customer satisfaction.
attributes.effect: Production damages exceeded the set limit of 0.2%, resulting to a revenue loss of Ksh. 7,952.37.

value:
• Production damages were caused by oven break down and poor follow up of the production process. We will enhance production control to  reduce production damages. 

  • Oven damages were caused by break down of oven burner.

• Production damages was contributed by production of low quality products, oven inefficiency, poor supervision.
  • We will ensure products produced are of high quality and production process is followed.

attributes.title: Market Damages
attributes.description:
Analysis was done on the market damages to determine if the were within the set limit of 0.5% of the total sales. The sample period was from 1st to 23rd  January, 2025.

It was found that market damages were averaging at 0.57%. The table below illustrates the findings.
attributes.recommendation: The branch to try  reduce  market damages to the required limit of 0.5% by ensuring products produced is of high quality.

value: We will improve on quality to reduce market damages.
